feed.title: Google Cloud: Cloud Build
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Cloud Build

entry.content:
Cloud Build is now available in the asia-southeast3 region.

For more information, see Cloud Build locations.
entry.summary: Cloud Build is now available in the asia-southeast3 region. This expansion provides a new option for users in this geographical area to leverage Cloud Build's CI/CD capabilities. For more details on supported regions, please refer to the Cloud Build locations documentation.
entry.title: Change: Cloud Build now in asia-southeast3

entry.content:
Cloud Build now supports OCI artifacts. OCI artifacts for a build are shown in the following locations:

  • The Artifacts column of Build history page
  • The Execution details tab of the Build details page
  • The Build Artifacts tab of the Build details page

For more information, see View build results.
entry.summary: Cloud Build now supports OCI artifacts, which can be viewed in the Build history and Build details pages. This enhancement allows for better management and visibility of build artifacts.
entry.title: Change: OCI artifact support in Cloud Build

entry.content: In build config files, the mavenArtifacts field now supports the deployFolder field. You can use the deployFolder field to upload all Maven files in a folder to a specific Artifact Registry repository. For more information, see Upload all Maven files in a folder to an Artifact Registry repository.
entry.summary: The `mavenArtifacts` field in build config files now supports the `deployFolder` field. This allows you to upload all Maven files within a specified folder directly to an Artifact Registry repository, simplifying your deployment process.
entry.title: Change: Deploy Maven Artifacts to Artifact Registry

entry.content:
The Service Account User role has been removed from the Cloud Build Permissions page in the Google Cloud Console. Instead, when you enable certain roles on your Cloud Build service account, you can configure your Cloud Build Service account to impersonate the service account of the managed services related to those roles. This configuration lets you deploy builds using managed services while maintaining minimal permissions. For more information, see Configure Cloud Build service account impersonation for managed services.

In addition, the Cloud Build Permissions page in the Google Cloud Console will only show the legacy Cloud Build service account if your organization's policy allows it.
entry.summary: The Service Account User role has been removed from the Cloud Build Permissions page. You can now configure your Cloud Build service account to impersonate other service accounts for enhanced security and flexibility.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Build Permissions Update

entry.content:
Developer Connect build triggers are now generally available.

You can now create build triggers that build from repositories connected to Developer Connect using the Google Cloud Console, gcloud, the Cloud Build API, and Terraform.
entry.summary: Build triggers for Developer Connect are now generally available. You can create these triggers using the Google Cloud Console, gcloud, the Cloud Build API, and Terraform.
entry.title: Feature: Developer Connect build triggers are now available

entry.content: Dark theme is now available for Cloud Build. To enable the dark theme, in the Google Cloud console, click Settings and utilities > Preferences. In the navigation menu, click Appearance, and then select your color theme and click Save.
entry.summary: Cloud Build now supports a dark theme. You can enable it through the console's Appearance settings.
entry.title: Feature: Dark Theme Available for Cloud Build

entry.content:
C3 and N2D machine families are now generally available in private pools. For a complete list of supported machines, see the machineType entry in the private pool configuration file schema.

In addition, the Create private pool and Edit private pool pages now show a monthly estimate based on the pool's machine type configuration. For more information, see View private pool price estimates.
entry.summary: New machine types available in private pools.
entry.title: Feature: C3 and N2D Machine Types Now Available

entry.content: You can now create build triggers that build from repositories connected to Developer Connect.
entry.summary: You can now create build triggers that build from repositories connected to Developer Connect. This integration allows for more streamlined CI/CD workflows by enabling builds directly from your connected repositories.
entry.title: Feature: Build Triggers Now Support Developer Connect Repositories
